title: Inventory and Warehouse Specialist
description:
Environmental Designers Irrigation, located in Wall, NJ, is seeking a **full-time Inventory and Warehouse Specialist**. With a competitive pay range of **$18 - $24 per hour** and a supportive work environment, this position offers an excellent opportunity to advance your career in a well-established company. We also offer **great benefits and perks** such as:

* Health insurance
* A 401(k)
* Employee incentive program
* Vacation discounts
* Coffee in our break room

 **YOUR TYPICAL DAY**


As an Inventory and Warehouse Specialist, you will be responsible for managing inventory stock and restocking received items. You will create detailed reports for restock orders to ensure optimal inventory levels. Your duties will include receiving ingoing and outgoing deliveries and maintaining an organized and efficient warehouse. Occasionally, you will deliver stock to job sites using a company vehicle. Your day will be dynamic and require effective teamwork and a proactive approach to various tasks supporting warehouse operations.

 **YOUR SCHEDULE**


This full-time position requires availability from **6:45 AM to 3:15 PM, Monday through Friday**.

 **REQUIREMENTS FOR AN INVENTORY AND WAREHOUSE SPECIALIST**

* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
* Clean driving record
* Working knowledge of Excel
* Excellent organizational skills


Experience in inventory management is preferred!

 **OUR MISSION**


Environmental Designers Irrigation has been making lawns greener while saving water since 1990. Based in Monmouth County, we service irrigation systems in a vast area encompassing New Jersey as well as parts of Pennsylvania and New York. Our company keeps both our customers and our employees at the heart of everything we do. We maintain a **supportive and collaborative environment** where **team members are always willing to lend a helping hand**. Our staff is **friendly, honest, and open with each other**. To thank our team for their hard work, we offer **solid wages and great benefits**. Check us out and see why reviewers say **we deserve "more than five stars"!**

 **READY TO APPLY?**


If you are ready to join a dedicated team and make a significant impact at Environmental Designers Irrigation, apply now using our quick 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Auto Shop Assistant Manager
description:
Are you ready to take your automotive career to the next level? AAMCO of East Brunswick, NJ has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a full-time **Auto Shop Assistant Manager** at one of our following locations: **Hightstown, South Plainfield, and Bridgewater, NJ**!

 **BECOMING ONE OF OUR AUTO SHOP ASSISTANT MANAGERS**


You'll get a **starting wage of $25 per hour plus bonuses with a review in 90 days.** You can enjoy great benefits such as **weekends and evenings off, paid time off, a signing bonus, great training, advancement opportunities, and access to AAMCO University's training programs to fuel your career**.

**DELVE DEEPER INTO THIS JOB**


In this role, you will be responsible for handling initial customer contact through incoming calls and walk-ins, creating work orders using our POS system (basic computer skills required), customer follow-up, and general office management. While prior experience in automotive customer service and service management is a plus, we value individuals who are hungry to learn and grow, demonstrate humility in their approach, and possess excellent problem-solving skills. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career opportunity, join our team and be part of a company that is at the forefront of the auto repair industry.

 **ABOUT AAMCO**


We are more than just an automotive repair shop; it's a commitment to excellence. Locally owned and operated by a seasoned dealer with 40 years of experience, we proudly hold the #1 position nationwide. Our track record boasts the most awards in the history of AAMCO, and we operate from a state-of-the-art facility. Our mission is to provide East Brunswick's drivers with top-tier service, and our values revolve around integrity, skill, and dedication. We tackle challenging jobs that often surpass the capabilities of other shops, while also covering everything from routine maintenance to complex repairs, making room for technicians at all levels.


We create a culture of continuous learning, where each technician can grow their skills and shape a rewarding career. That's why our technicians have access to industry-leading training through AAMCO University, allowing them to reach higher levels of expertise than traditional shops can offer. We're looking for hungry individuals who are eager to elevate their careers. Join our team and grow with us!

 **THE TYPE OF CANDIDATE WE'RE LOOKING FOR**

If you can meet the requirements and characteristics listed above, we need you on our team!

title: Operations Manager
description:
**Spectrum Painting** in **Pompton Lakes, NJ** is currently hiring a **full-time** **Operations Manager**  

to join our team**. Not everyone will qualify, so please read the requirements carefully.**  

First-year compensation is $60,000+ plus benefits, based on work history and experience. This position will grow as the company grows.  

You will be responsible for overseeing crews and work throughout the Northern New Jersey area, approx. a 1-hour radius around Pompton Lakes, NJ.  

You must live within 45min of Pompton Lakes and have an excellent driving record.  

You must be experienced in overseeing multiple crews, giving feedback, managing customers, and Leading other Leaders.  

Your competencies include:* Jobsite safety
* Personal organization
* Building teams and leaders
* Scheduling and making assignments
* Problem-solving and successful customer service
* Using technology
* Constant learning
* Lean/Six-Sigma quality and process improvement, white or green-belt a plus
* Painting/Home Improvement background

Apply now for this **Operations Manager** position using our initial quick and easy mobile-optimized application.

title: Business Consulting Manager - Financial Services - Business Transformation - Channels - Call Center
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.  

Business Consulting Manager - Financial Services - Business Transformation – Channels – Call Center: This position could be located in NY, TX, NC.

  

United States

  

EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!

  

The Business Transformation practice offers global and regional financial services clients the assistance needed to improve their performance in a rapidly changing business environment. We assemble experienced multidisciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global reach, depth of capabilities and knowledge. Collectively, the group has a comprehensive skill set, which supports the delivery of operations, technology, product, sales, compliance, and risk projects for top clients in the U.S. financial services industry.

  



The objective of our Business Transformation – Consumer Banking Practice is to support financial services to continually innovate, transform to retain relevance, and deliver on growth. You can expect to work with client resources to analyze, evaluate, and enhance transformational programs within the retail banking, consumer lending and payment product spaces. All engagements are framed within the context of addressing our clients’ most pressing needs and informed by their long-term strategic priorities. Our Consumer Banking offerings utilize and deploy cross-functional teams for projects spanning across the following domains: Consumer Banking Optimization, Modernizing the Ecosystem, Workforce Transformation and Operational Efficiency.

  



The opportunity:

  

You will have the chance to be part of a fast-moving, high-growth company. We offer variety, challenge, responsibility and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. If you are interested in being part of a dynamic team, serving clients and reaching your full potential, EY Consulting is for you!

  

Your key responsibilities:

  

As a Manager Consultant, you’re likely to spend most of your time on operational and technical aspects of client business. That means developing an in-depth understanding of our clients’ unique needs and goals. The Manager Consultant will take direction and guidance from both project team and client resources. You will be specifically responsible for supporting the delivery of a project workstream, creating and reviewing work products, ensuring consistent delivery across peers and team members, responding to client requests, delegating tasks and overseeing junior level resources, and supporting engagement operations.

  

A Manager Consultant is also expected to contribute to internal EY initiatives and business development, in addition to client facing work, to further the development of our brand, our business and our people.

  

Skills and Attributes for Success:

* Knowledgeable in capabilities (Channels, specifically Call Center)
* Technologies and Operations in Call Centers
* Industry Trends around call center (operations and tech)
* Poven experience in developing thought leadership
* Knowledge around customer centricity
* 5+ years experience, ideally experience in a project environment

To qualify for the role, you must have:

  

* 5 years related work experience, specifically within Consumer channels, deposits, product management, operations, lending, or fintech
* Experience and knowledge of Channel (branch, online, mobile, contact center, relationship manager) transformation experience with a focus on contact center operations, technology and best practices
* Knowledge of consumer banking products and services such as deposits, checking, payments, mortgage, auto finance, credit cards, cryptocurrency transactions, etc.
* Experience with operating model design to define target state business, operations, technology, and control partner functions
* Experience performing current state and future state assessment, gap analysis, process assessment, reengineering and operational implementation experience  

Experience in Capability Maturity Model planning, roadmap development and investment prioritization for large-scale, strategic, and transformative initiatives
* Experience in Core Platform Transformation to support the changing business and regulatory landscape, enabling the realization of strategic business priorities including improved client experience, market expansion and easier partner/correspondent banking integration


Ideally, you’ll also have experience in:

  



* Consumer Banking / Lending experience across the customer lifecycle (e.g. sales/origination, underwriting, fulfillment, servicing, accounting, monitoring, account closing, collections and default
* Process design, modeling and automation for end to end customer journeys or operations
* Channel (branch, online, mobile, contact center, relationship manager) transformation experience
* Experience performing current state and future state assessment, operating model design, gap analysis, process assessment, reengineering and operational implementation experience
* Experience supporting core system conversion and client migrations
* Experience in design, testing, and implementation of technology-enabled solutions
* Experience in vendor assessment, selection, and transformation
* Knowledge of workforce readiness, mobilization, and sales force effectiveness.

  

What we look for:

  

We’re interested in natural leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve their full potential, this role is for you.

  

What working at EY offers:

  

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, flexible vacation time to use at your discretion for rest, recreation and personal activities, 19 observed holidays, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

* The opportunity to manage a portfolio of talent within a designated service line
* A collaborative environment where everyone works together to create a better working world
* Excellent training and development prospects, both through established programs and on-the-job training
* An excellent team of manager colleagues, dedicated to managing and varying your workload

About EY:

  

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

  



Join us in building a better working world.

  



Apply now.

  



EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $127,100 to $233,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $152,500 to $264,800. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

  

For those living in California, please click here for additional information.

  

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

  


EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

title: FY23 Financial Services Audit - WAM - Manager - Central, New England, Northeast 1
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.  

This position could be located in NY, MA, IL, WI, MN, OH.

  

EY is a leader in serving the global financial services marketplace and the only professional services firm with a separate business unit dedicated to the financial services industry – the Financial Services Organization (FSO). Our focused model and bold ambition have put us at the center of the events that continue to reshape and redefine our industry, working side by side with a range of clients from our most venerable institutions to dynamic new entrants across Banking and Capital Markets, Wealth and Asset Management and Insurance. Our purpose is to help build a financial services industry in which financial institutions are trusted and flourish, and the global economy is healthy, growing and secure. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve complex challenges, then come join our dynamic FSO team!

  

Our Financial Services Organization is a unique, industry-focused practice, and the only one of its kind within a Big 4 firm — and the Wealth and Asset Management is a key sector within this area. With strong functional capabilities, industry-leading technology and a varied range of knowledge, our clients look to us for assurance services they can rely on every time. And as an Audit Manager, you'll be at the heart of that goal, personally visiting high-profile clients on site to understand their unique needs and build your reputation as a trusted business advisor.

  

The opportunity


This is an area that has seen substantial investment, focused on technology, knowledge and development for assurance professionals. You'll see that reflected in your career, with plenty of opportunities to take on new responsibilities. That could mean developing a deep professional knowledge base in one area, or diversifying to audit in other markets such as wealth and asset management, hedge fund, and private equity.

  

Your key responsibilities


You're likely to balance your time between managing a team of assurance professionals across a portfolio of projects, and personally engaging with our clients. It's the perfect role if you're looking to diversify your professional management skills and experiences, all while further developing your leadership skills.

  

Skills and attributes for success

* Performing complex and specific audit procedures, while developing effective, client-focused audit strategies
* Coaching and managing a driven team of audit professional, facilitating them to have the information, tools and opportunities they need to grow
* Proactively building relationships that support our ability to provide tailored services that meet a wide range of assurance needs and contribute to new business development
* Identifying and reacting to potential risks and developing new ways to improve our products and processes that promote growth and increase revenue
* Continually updating your understanding of business trends and emerging technologies to maintain your reputation as a trusted business advisor

  

To qualify for the role you must have

* A bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business or Finance, supported by significant work experience as an auditor in a public accounting firm.
* A record of excellence in serving clients across the WAM industry
* A CPA certification in the work state location
* Engagement management, execution and reporting skills, and the ability to build relationships with clients with a diverse range of backgrounds
* Confidence in your ability to prioritize when managing multiple project simultaneously
* The ability and willingness to travel and work in excess of standard hours when necessary
* Access to reliable transportation to/from the EY office and client sites. A driver's license is strongly recommended as ride share and public transportation options may not be available in all locations

  

Ideally you'll also have

* A firm understanding of engagement economics
* A proven ability to build a network of contacts and mutual business relationships

  

What we look for


We're interested in leaders who are creative and agile thinkers, with a genuine interest in improving our audit capabilities. You'll also need to be a capable communicator both in the boardroom and across your team. If you have the technical and personal skills to understand our clients and provide excellent services every time, this role is for you.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $97,200 to $178,200. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $116,700 to $202,500. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Execute resource and scheduling for complex assignments that require extensive relationships with engagement subarea managers. title: FedEx Delivery Professional
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


EARNED PTO, HEALTH, AND OTHER BENEFITS AVAILABLE AFTER 90 DAYS!


Eagle Logistics is a contracted service provider for FedEx Ground and is looking to hire full-time delivery drivers. We are looking for motivated and dependable individuals to work as part of a team! 40+ Hours a week 4-5 day work weeks with weekend availability. Must be 21 or older to apply.


$18.00/hr starting pay, even during training! Annual raises! Paid Holidays!


Must work Sunday!!


CDL License is NOT required!!! Come and join a great transportation team! Amazon, UPS, USPS, FedEx, or DHL experience is a plus!


Schedule: 8am until route completion (full time drivers get at least 40 hours/week)!


Weekly Paycheck: $18.00/hour with annual raises and safety bonus!


Delivery Driver Requirements:


* Clean Motor Vehicle Record
* Applicants must be 21 years of age or older
* 1 Year of Driving Experience for a job (Uber/construction/landscaping/medical transport/etc) preferred but not required.
* Must be able to pass a Drug Test and DOT Medical / Physical Exam (Paid by Employer!)
* Must submit to a background check
* Physically able to handle packages up to 150 lbs.


Delivery Driver Responsibilities:


* Loading and Unloading packages from truck
* Delivering packages to destination
* Scanning and Logging Packages
* Accurately delivering 150-175 stops per day on average
* Practicing safe driving techniques


Delivery Driver Benefits:


* Health insurance (medical/dental/vision)
* Life insurance
* Paid vacation after 1 year
* Safety bonuses
* Annual pay evaluation and opportunity for growth
* Weekly direct deposit


Job Types: Full-time and Part-time


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time


Salary: From $18.00 per hour


Benefits:


* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off


Day range:


* Weekend availability


Shift:


* Day shift


Application Question(s):


* For immediate consideration, what is your phone number? and email?


License/Certification:


* Driver's License (Required)

title: Full-Time Pediatric 1:1 Nurse (RN) - Westchester County, NY
description:

**Our passionate and talented team members have made The Accucare Difference, our commitment to empowering our nurses to provide, maintain, and achieve a patient's optimal health. Starting the day you apply, our team will guide you each step of the process. Accucare will be an essential asset to your career. Work for a company started by nurses for nurses. Join us today!**

**Job Details:**

* Openings vary by case and location
* Weekday, weekend, daytime, and overnight shifts available

* Some cases may require tracheostomy and/or ventilator experience

* $42-45/hr

* Paid Vacation & Sick time

* Training provided including paid clinical orientation, preceptorship, and ongoing skills labs

* 24 Hour Support

* Tuition reimbursement after 6 months and CEU credits
* Referral Bonus & Incentive Programs
* Remote onboarding available
* Sign on bonus paid incrementally

**Apply now for immediate consideration. Take a look at our other listings to find a job that fits your needs!**

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
Exciting opportunity to join Alay Home Care as a Direct Support Professional! Be part of a team dedicated to providing companionship and support to individuals in need. With a pay range of **$20.50/hr - $28.00/hr**, this position offers competitive compensation for your valuable time and skills. Bring your passion for making a difference in someone's life to our onsite role.


You can get great benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, and Paid Time Off. If you are a compassionate individual looking for a rewarding role, apply now to start your journey with us!

### **WHO ARE WE? AN INTRODUCTION**


Alay Home Care is a DDD Provider established in 2018. Since opening, we have serviced over 300 consumers throughout New Jersey. We're devoted to supporting individuals with Developmental Disabilities by providing Direct Care Staff in the Home and Community Settings. Our team has been in the home care industry for over 22 years, consisting of a group of highly experienced and knowledgeable team members.

### **MAKE A DIFFERENCE AS A DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL**


As a Direct Support Professional at Alay Home Care, you will play a vital role in providing personalized care to individuals by assisting with activities of daily living, offering companionship, and serving as a mentor in various aspects of life. From running errands to providing emotional support and mentorship in academic and career development, your impact will help enhance the quality of life for those under your care. You will also contribute to community support efforts, ensuring individuals remain connected and engaged within their communities. With a focus on behavioral support and medication administration, your role will be essential in fostering a positive and nurturing environment for those in need. Join us in making a difference in the lives of others today!

### **DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**


Successful candidates for the role of Direct Support Professional at Alay Home Care must possess exceptional interpersonal skills to build meaningful connections with individuals in need. Strong organization and time management skills are essential to effectively assist with daily living activities and provide companionship. The ability to handle challenging behaviors with patience and empathy is crucial, along with a compassionate and understanding demeanor.


Candidates should also demonstrate proficiency in medication administration and be adept at providing emotional and social support. Prior experience in caregiving or a related field is preferred but not required, as we provide comprehensive training to support your success in this rewarding role.

### **CONNECT WITH OUR TEAM TODAY!**


If you feel that this job is what you're looking for, applying is a piece of cake - **You can send your resume to** **recruitment@alayhc.com** **and one of our recruiters will get back to you!**

title: Lead Negotiator
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.  

The Lead Negotiator is a “deal closer” who leads all aspects of a holistic negotiation strategy and manages the EY deal team, and the client’s team, to a collaborative and mutually value-based outcome. The role is primarily responsible for working on EY’s largest, most complex deals, and must have a high level of business acumen, leadership skills and emotional intelligence to be an effective “first chair” on the deal.

 **The opportunity**

  

The role must be able to thrive in new and unfamiliar environments, as each deal and client is different, and navigate the client’s behavior and tactics to maintain the integrity of the deal for EY. The position also involves the ability to lead training classes and presentations on best practices in negotiation, with the objective of driving a disciplined approach to deal-making, seeking to influence the business as broadly and deeply as possible in order to have a material impact on outcomes.

 **Your key responsibilities include**

  

* Understand and become a trusted advisor to the sector or service line assigned and make the value proposition for the negotiator role clear and impactful
* Expand the portfolio of engagements through outstanding work, networking and presentations
* Document and quantify the results of the engagements to demonstrate the value and ROI of the skills the team brings to the business
* Help to manage, mentor and grow the team to develop mastery and confidence in their skills and to advance their careers
* Lead the actual negotiation process as a “first chair” with the client’s negotiation lead to take the engagement from “sold” to “closed”
* Collaborate with the EY sales lead on relationship mapping and tiering to align EY’s people with the appropriate client leaders
* Provide advice and strategies on how to get client commitment to a close plan
* Lead the deal-making process to document, and then get agreement with the client on, the terms of the deal
* Provide advice / counsel to pursuit teams on the various commercial models available for large complex deals
* Maintain oversight of global priority deals across relevant Regions to ensure flow through EY’s negotiation methodology
* Lead successful activation and implementation of global negotiations strategy in Area / Region respectively
* Act as a key conduit of information between the account team and P&CE leadership
* Team closely with regional business development leaders to advise and strategize on deal opportunities.
* Cascade EY’s negotiation methodology as a global best practice; and bring process consistency and synergies for negotiations to the Regions and client accounts by example and through EY training programs
* Build relationships with Global and Regional leadership to enable successful activation and implementation of EY’s negotiation methodology at the Region level
* Leverage proximity and relationships with Global, Area, Service Lines and Regions to facilitate and encourage successful integration of EY’s negotiation methodology across priority deals in the region
* Instill exceptional client service into the end-to-end negotiations process across EY

 **Skills and attributes for success**

  

* Strong business and commercial acumen as well as sales capability to quickly become familiar with a given solution
* Capable of leading and being part of EY teams in a complex matrix and unstructured environments with teams geographically distributed
* A high level of drive, ability to work independently and deal effectively with ambiguity and change Fluency of best practice in technology services contract drafting and ability to translate these for EY pursuits

 **To qualify for the role, you must be**

  

* Trusted Strategic Advisor – Build Trust and credibility by proactively providing forward-thinking insights and guidance
* Gold Standard Champion – Execute EY’s “gold standard” pursuit process with discipline and expertise
* Win-Win Advocate – Drive internal and external clients towards outcomes that deliver compelling and sustainable results for both the client and EY
* Creativity and innovation Driver – Inspire and challenge teams to differentiate EY through innovative strategies, experiences, and deliverables that compel our clients to choose EY

 **Ideally, you’ll also have**

  

* 5+ years’ experience of negotiation and contract drafting experience in commercial and legal terms with substantial experience in the technology services industry (managed services/BPO/system integration/consulting)
* Completion of Miller Heiman methodology courses within 1-2 years of hire


**What we offer**

The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary ranges. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $160,000 to $308,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $192,000 to $350,000. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


**If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

title: Strategy and Transactions - Investment Banking - SVP/Director - Life Sciences/Medtech
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. **Location:** New York, Cleveland, Nashville.

  

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


Ernst & Young Capital Advisors, LLC (EYCA) offers investment banking services with access to a global network of EY mergers & acquisitions, debt capital markets and equity capital markets professionals. The global EY network offers a comprehensive suite of services, and EY firms consistently rank among the leading financial services firms based on the number of completed transactions globally.

  

As an M&A Investment Banking Senior Manager you’ll provide clients with objective advice on corporate financing alternatives through highly focused industry teams with world class, global execution capabilities. You’ll be an important part of our diversely talented, highly experienced team and work at the forefront of high-profile transactions.

 **The opportunity**


You’ll be working in a team environment with corporate finance and legacy investment banking professionals on a variety of projects across a range of sectors. Our team works to understand the client’s business profit drivers and trends, as well as challenge assumptions of future performance and assist with purchase agreements and post-closing transaction matters.

 **Your key responsibilities**


As an M&A Investment Banking Senior Manager you will be a vital member of the team leading and executing corporate finance engagements. You’ll be focused on analyzing financial data and identifying key trends behind the performance of a business, discussing business performance and forecast assumptions with senior team management, and helping to write reports that set out our findings and recommendations around the key financial and business issues in a transaction. You will also help develop team members ensuring their career development.

 **Skills and attributes for success**

* Advise companies regarding strategic and corporate finance alternatives.
* Supervise, coach and mentor analysts and associates to prepare compelling pitch books offering descriptive memoranda and related materials for M&A and capital raising mandates.
* Identify prospective investors and buyers for M&A and capital raising mandates.
* Perform extensive financial analysis, valuation analysis and pro forma financial modeling.
* Identify key issues and potential areas of valuation and transaction risk within engagements.
* Perform In-depth sector market and company-specific research.
* Contribute to recruiting and team development initiatives.

 **To qualify for the role you must have**

* A bachelor's degree and at least 8 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and at least 7 years of related work experience.
* Extensive investment banking experience.
* Existing Series 7 and/or 79 plus Series 63 securities licenses (in good standing).
* Ability to work directly with clients as the most senior banking team representative able to manage all client deliverables.
* Strong experience with both identifying transactions and leading a team in execution.
* Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills with the ability to develop and maintain relationships at all levels of the organization.
* Willingness and ability to travel as necessary at short notice.

 **Ideally you’ll also have**

* A proven record of excellence in investment banking specific to mergers, acquisitions and capital markets.
* Experience gained within another large professional services organization.
* Established networking skills in a relevant industry.

 **What we look for**


We’re interested in talented professionals with the ability to visualize our clients’ goals and think creatively to facilitate them - often in politically charged environments. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, and a genuine passion for taking on new challenges, this role is for you.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $265,000 to $325,000. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

title: Enterprise Change and Release Team Lead
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  

Enterprise Technology provides reliable, secure and resilient technology services and solutions to support over 300,000 EY people. As part of Enterprise Technology, you’ll be at the forefront of enabling innovative technologies including emerging collaboration tools and world-class technology infrastructure.

  

Our aim is to build an outstanding customer experience with clear investment in innovation, alongside operational excellence that delivers efficient, quality services and solutions. You will work with technologists and business specialists to meet the increasing pace of our business. That means more growth for you, exciting learning opportunities, career choices, and the chance to make a real impact.

 **The opportunity**

  

Managing/coordinating release schedules working across a very complex landscape of multiple applications, platforms, and delivery frameworks. This role is ideal for someone with a blend of technical expertise, operational excellence, leadership skill set, and with strong prioritization, facilitation, and communication skills

 **Key responsibilities**

  

* A team leader who is hands on with experience across SDLC for release & change at enterprise level, large scale software & platform release
* Can be the face and voice of the change and release team for EY CRM, working with and reporting to senior leaders in EY Technology
* Client facing with stakeholders, presenting and reporting on progress
* Can adopt and enhance EY technology enterprise level processes & procedures to manage change at scale
* Have experience of working with a change and release board
* Experienced in major and minor software releases working with BAs, developers, architects and program teams
* Scheduling and planning both teams and releases across 12 a month calendar and beyond
* Working closely with other partner technology teams to agree schedules, plans, explain priorities and negotiate at manager level for EY CRM
* Be responsible for a year end audit of the EY CRM SDLC processes and ensure the wider team has correctly managed change
* Team mentorship
* Managing junior and senior change managers
* A positive can-do attitude. Approaches meetings with energy and positivity. Builds great working relationships across the program team
* Experience with ERP large scale systems such as finance, CRM, data warehouse, or similar enterprise solutions supporting companies across multiple countries and over 100,000 users are very beneficial for success.

  

Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:

  



* Senior communication capability required with Global Markets, Service Line and ET leadership. The role also requires relationship management skills to influence and motivate resources from ET that will not be direct reports.

  



**Knowledge and Skills Requirements:**

  



The role requires a good working knowledge of the IT infrastructure within EY but more importantly a great perspective on the business and the internal stakeholders we serve. The functional requirements of the technology we acquire, build or modify depend on the role’s ability to translate business need into technical requirements. A longer-term roadmap and vision for individual application as well as the broader platforms will be necessary for effective development and deployment of the projects

  



* Understanding and knowledge of CRM processes and systems would be a distinct advantage. Any prior knowledge or experience of Dynamics 365 preferred.
* Experience working in Scaled Agile Framework with proven track record of successful execution.
* Proven ability to drive change and work effectively across business boundaries.
* Partner with Product Owners, and business partners to ensure alignment on strategy, vision, road map and execution.
* Work with leadership, Product Owners, and other stakeholders to help ensure strategy and execution alignment.
* Tracks and communicates key metrics, such as feature, business value and implementation.
* Extensive use and experience with Azure Dev Ops, Jira or a similar technology

  



**To qualify for the role you must have**

  

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or related business discipline(s).
* 8+ years of Change and Release Team Leader experience.
* Experience with any of CRM platforms is preferred.
* Excellent analytical, problem solving, decision making, interpersonal and communication skills.
* High motivated, self-directed individual with the ability to work independently.
* Experience with multiple SDLC methodologies (waterfall, unified, Agile).
* Strong project management capabilities with ability to multi-task.
* Knowledge of Microsoft CRM Dynamics is a great plus.
* Implementation or migration experience with any CRM or ERP project.
* Microsoft Office products are a must have.
* Solid understanding of Scrum, Kanban, Lean, SAFe
* Strong conflict resolution skills required.
* The following Licensing/Certifications are preferred: SAFe, Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), SAFe Scrum Master (SSM), SAFe Advanced Scrum Master, Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) or other related certifications.

  



**What we look for**

  

* A self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion


**What we offer**

The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary ranges.

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $110,200 to $200,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $132,200 to $227,300. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

title: Supply Chain Adv - Bus Cons - Supply Chain and Ops - Transformation - Manager - Mult Pos - 1526797
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. **Supply Chain Advisor, Business Consulting - Supply Chain & Operations (Transformation) (Manager) (Multiple Positions) (1526797), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, Hoboken, NJ.**

  

Help clients understand the health of their supply chains. Analyze supply chain processes to identify and recommend changes. Analyze supply chain data and apply analytic methods to advise clients on how to understand, predict, and control supply chain operations and processes throughout the end-to-end supply chain. Advise on Rapid Supply Chain Assessment, Sales & Operations Planning, Procurement, Logistics, Global Trade Optimization (GTO), and/or Operating Model Effectiveness (OME). Conduct current state assessments of the supply chain. Assist clients in setting outputs to satisfy planned sales, purchasing materials, and logistics flow of product between origin and consumption. Advise on improvements to supply chains in emerging markets, and work with sustainability teams to integrate environmental, sustainable and low carbon aspects into end-to-end supply chains. Help clients incorporate tax, customs, and security constraints within a global supply chain, and reduce tax burdens.  

  

Manage and motivate teams of professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Cultivate business development opportunities.

  

Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm.

 **MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**

  

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Logistics, or a related field and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in one or a combination of any of the following: advisory, consulting, and/or industry experience. Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Business, Management, Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain, Logistics, or related field and 4 years of one or a combination of any of the following: advisory, consulting, and/or industry work experience.

  

Must have 4 years of experience in one or a combination of any of the following supply chain and operational areas that impact the supply chain function: assessments, supply chain strategy, operating model design, distribution/logistics, network optimization, inventory management, procurement and sourcing, lean-six sigma, sales and operations planning, and/or operations cost reduction.

  

Must have 4 years of experience using Excel, Macros, and Pivot Tables.

  

Must have 4 years of experience writing and delivering presentations for executives and senior managers in Power Point.

  

Must have 2 years of experience with conducting and delivering supply chain analytical results.

  

Must have 2 years of experience managing staff on projects and providing direction to team members.

  

Must have facilitated at least 4 multifunctional workshops.

  

Requires travel up to 80%, of which 20% may be international, to serve client needs.

  

Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience.

The base salary for this job is $175,004.00 per year. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

title: Financial Risk Management - Capital Management and Stress Testing - Manager
description:
Financial Risk Management - Capital Management and Stress Testing – Manager: This position could be located in NY, NC, IL.

  

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

  

We help the world’s largest financial institutions navigate the intricate regulatory environment to effectively manage and assess capital adequacy in support of their ongoing strategies. More than ever, financial institutions are investing in enhancing their capital management capabilities to make better business decisions, presenting us with the unique opportunity to rally together to solve our clients’ most complex challenges.

 **The opportunity**


You’ll be a part of a collegiate environment, all about teaming and a “we before I” culture. You will lead diverse client engagement teams to help our clients with a broad range of advisory services and provide meaningful insights across risk management, treasury, front office, middle office, and back office on a broad spectrum of financial and capital topics and activities.

  

In return, you can expect leading-class learning and development tailored to your unique interests and motivations. You can expect to progress and become ready to build a better working world for our people, our clients, and the communities that support us. You’ll also work on challenging projects alongside some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business.

 **Your key responsibilities**


Advise and provide clients with strategic recommendations on Financial Risk Management issues facing the financial services sector, focusing on the identification, measurement, and management of regulatory capital. Consistently deliver quality client services. Demonstrate technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Cultivate business development opportunities.

  

You’ll spend most of your time leading and teaming with capital management, stress testing and industry professionals to develop and deliver a wide range of capital planning and management strategies and solutions including but not limited to providing strategic and tactical advice on the implementation of strategic processes and business-as-usual enhancements as well as legislative and regulatory requirements such as, Comprehensive Capital Adequacy and Review (CCAR), Recovery and Resolution Planning (RRP), Basel regulatory capital including Basel 3 End Game (B3E) and other capital management activities.

  



Everything you’ll do will come back to providing exceptional services to our clients. Colleagues and clients will look to you to lead components of the project, drive high quality results while coaching and motivating staff and managing client expectations. You will build your knowledge and experience, become a trusted advisor, and take your career to new heights.

 **Skills and attributes for success**

* Structuring and planning projects in the capital management, stress testing, and planning space across a broad range of areas, including, CCAR, RRP, B3E, regulatory capital, and other capital management and stress testing activities
* Developing technical capabilities in a wide range of capital management and stress testing disciplines
* Conducting field work, project management, and developing high-quality work products within expected timeframes
* Managing project risk and effectively communicating with engagement leaders and key stakeholders regarding status, issues and key priorities to achieve expected outcomes
* Understanding clients’ unique ambitions and needs and referring them to colleagues in other teams and areas to broaden our business relationships
* Leading and managing a team of professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds
* Providing constructive feedback and coaching to team members, and fostering an innovative and inclusive, team-oriented work environment
* Playing an active role in coaching and mentoring associates within the organization
* Cultivating and maintaining client relationships
* Demonstrating teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and staying abreast of industry trends relevant to client's business

 **To qualify for the role you must have**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, accounting, engineering or a related discipline and more than 5 years of related/relevant work experience; an MBA or Master’s degree in finance, economics, accounting, management or a related field and 2 years of work experience in the Financial Services industry
* Relevant experience in the financial services industry with either internal consulting organization, or within front office or risk office functions or related areas at leading financial services institutions, or a consulting firm in the following areas:
* Corporate Treasury
* Capital Planning and Management
* Corporate stress testing support functions
* Financial planning and analysis,
* Treasury operations,
* ALM/balance sheet management
* Regulatory / Product / Financial Control functions
* The flexibility to constantly learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Advanced project management and client service skills
* Ability to understand business challenges and translate them into value add solutions
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent leadership and teaming skills
* A willingness to travel to meet client needs. A valid driver’s license in the US and a valid passport required; willingness and ability to travel internationally

  



**What we look for**


If you’re a natural leader, with a talent for answering and communicating complex client problems, we’re interested in you. You’ll need to be great at influencing people, ready to listen and confident in challenging the status quo. If you’ve a genuine passion for helping businesses address their most pressing problems, this role is for you.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $117,300 to $215,100. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $140,800 to $244,400. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

title: Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant HouseCalls - Putnam, Westchester Counties, NY
description:
**We offer up to $40,000 Student Loan Repayment or a $30,000 Sign-on Bonus for individuals who have not previously participated in this Optum program.**



Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  



As a team member of our HouseCalls product, we provide annual clinical assessments to patients in the comfort of their homes. This important preventive care helps identify and reduce health risks for patients, in addition to coordinating appropriate follow-up care to improve health and well-being.

  



We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  



In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. Flexible scheduling offered where providers can flex their time over the 7-day work week. No on-call, no weekends and no holidays required.



**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Conduct in-home assessments including an evaluation of past medical history, review of systems, medication reconciliation, vital signs, and comprehensive physical exam
* Perform evidence-based practice screenings including point of care testing (as appropriate)
* Identify diagnoses to be used in care management and active medical management in the furtherance of treatment
* Formulate a list of current and past medical conditions using clinical knowledge and judgment and the findings of your assessment
* Communicate findings in your assessment that will be used to inform member’s PCP of potential gaps in care
* Identify urgent and emergent situations and intervene appropriately
* Educate members on topics such as disease process, medication, and compliance

  



You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Active NP license or ability to obtain by start date. Licensure must be unencumbered, free of any open/unresolved disciplinary actions including probation or restrictions against privilege to practice
* Active ANCC or AANP national certification in Family, Geriatrics, Adult, Adult-Gerontology Primary Care, or Adult-Gerontology Acute Care certification, or the ability to obtain national certification and/or NP license in state of assignment by start date
* Ability to complete physical requirements of the job including lifting a 30-pound bag in and out of the car, navigating stairs and a variety of dwelling conditions, and sit, stand and kneel to perform physical assessment
* Reliable transportation to complete home visit assessments

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 1+ years of clinical experience in their highest level of education, clinical setting
* May be requested to obtain additional licensure in other geographic areas
* Experience in gerontology, cardiology, internal medicine, or endocrinology
* Home Health care or home visit experience
* Ability to travel throughout the state, beyond your assigned region, up to 5% of the time. Based on business needs with advanced notice, eligible for additional compensation incentives
* Fluency in Spanish, Cantonese, Korean, Vietnamese, Polish, or other language

  


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*



*#RPOLinkedIn*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: EY Public Relations Lead FSO, Associate Director
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. **Location:** Hoboken, Charlotte, New York, Boston, Atlanta, Miami, Chicago

  

Join our Core Business Services (CBS) team and you will help support the important business enablement functions that keep our organization running strong. As a CBS professional, you will work across teams to provide the knowledge, resources and tools that help EY deliver exceptional quality service to our clients, win in the marketplace and support EY’s growth and profitability. Major teams within CBS include Finance, Information Technology, Human Resources, Enterprise Support Services, Brand Marketing and Communications, Business Development, Knowledge and Risk Management.

  

Join our Brand, Marketing and Communications (BMC) team as Associate Director – Financial Services PR Lead and you will directly support and promote our brand and reputation. Through public relations and corporate communications, you’ll provide a wide range of services to various audiences, including current and future clients and employees, alumni, regulators, the media and the communities in which we operate.

  

With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, clients and communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

 **Job Summary:**

  

As Associate Director, Financial Services – Public Relations (PR) Lead, you'll develop and execute external communications strategies and campaigns to support business priorities and promote EY's image in the market. This role will support the EY Financial Services practice and help the firm gain positive exposure, support the brand and visibility of our Financial Services leaders and create business opportunities. In this role, you'll lead independently, and interact frequently with the firm's leaders, marketing team, public policy, and general counsel’s office.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Partner with EY management, to understand business objectives, and establish PR programs that promote the firm, our Financial Services Organization and its leaders
* Develop public relations plans, including media relations and social media initiatives and support EY's public sponsorships and events
* Build positive relationships with journalists (television, radio, magazine and newspaper) to gain positive exposure for the firm, which should lead to business opportunities
* Promote EY through media briefings, news releases, conferences, round tables and articles
* Manage the external PR agency supporting the Financial Services Organization, including time and budget management, conceptualizing creative program strategies, co-creating position, messaging and talking point content, and facilitating execution of program plan and key campaigns
* Analyze appropriate communications channels, to build awareness of the firm's key messages
* Gain a good understanding of the firm's practice area
* Work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment

 **To qualify, candidates must have:**

* Expert in media and social media engagement
* Supervisory skills, including delegating, coaching, defining expectations, etc.
* Excellent project management, client service, team-building and interpersonal skills
* Ability to meet tight deadlines
* Proficient with standard technology including Microsoft Windows, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and internet
* A minimum of 7 years related experience
* Bachelor's degree; Masters degree preferred


**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $130,500 to $251,200. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $156,600 to $285,400. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.



EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**
**The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.****EY | Building a better working world**

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
